faq.title: Frequently asked questions about ideal weight

faqItems.q: How to calculate your ideal weight?
faqItems.a: Ideal weight is calculated using various formulas based on height, gender and age. The simplest Broca formula: For men = Height - 100, For women = Height - 110. More accurate formulas take into account additional factors.

faqItems.q: What is the most accurate ideal weight formula?
faqItems.a: There is no single most accurate formula. Each formula has its own characteristics and takes into account different factors. It is recommended to use several formulas and take the average value. Lorentz's formula is considered one of the most accurate.

faqItems.q: What is the difference between Broca's and Lorentz's formulas?
faqItems.a: Brock's formula is simple: Ideal weight = Height - 100 (men) or Height - 110 (women). The Lorenz formula is more accurate: For men = (Height - 100) - (Height - 150) / 4, For women = (Height - 100) - (Height - 150) / 2. The Lorenz formula gives more accurate results for people of average height.

faqItems.q: Does the calculator take age into account?
faqItems.a: Some formulas (Devina, Humvee) partially take into account age through adjustments. However, most formulas are based primarily on height and gender. For a more accurate calculation based on age, consultation with a doctor is recommended.

faqItems.q: What is the ideal weight for a man 180 cm tall?
faqItems.a: According to Brock's formula: 180 - 100 = 80 kg. According to the Lorentz formula: (180 - 100) - (180 - 150) / 4 = 80 - 7.5 = 72.5 kg. According to Devin's formula: 50 + 2.3 × (180 / 2.54 - 60) ≈ 75 kg. Typically, the ideal weight for a 180 cm man is 72-80 kg.

faqItems.q: What is the ideal weight for a woman 165 cm tall?
faqItems.a: According to Brock's formula: 165 - 110 = 55 kg. According to the Lorentz formula: (165 - 100) - (165 - 150) / 2 = 65 - 7.5 = 57.5 kg. According to Devin's formula: 45.5 + 2.3 × (165 / 2.54 - 60) ≈ 57 kg. Typically, the ideal weight for a woman 165 cm is 55-58 kg.

faqItems.q: Does age affect ideal weight?
faqItems.a: Yes, as you age, your metabolism slows down and your normal weight may increase slightly. However, most ideal weight formulas do not take age directly into account. To take age into account, consultation with a doctor or nutritionist is recommended.

faqItems.q: What is Devin's formula?
faqItems.a: Devin's formula is a formula for calculating ideal weight that takes into account height in inches. For men: Ideal weight = 50 + 2.3 × (Height in inches - 60). For women: Ideal weight = 45.5 + 2.3 × (Height in inches - 60). The formula is popular in medicine.

faqItems.q: What is the Humvee formula?
faqItems.a: The Humvee formula is another formula for calculating your ideal weight. For men: Ideal weight = 48 + 2.7 × (Height in inches - 60). For women: Ideal weight = 45.5 + 2.2 × (Height in inches - 60). The formula gives results close to Devin's formula.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ideal weight using Lorentz's formula?
faqItems.a: Lorenz formula: For men = (Height - 100) - (Height - 150) / 4. For women = (Height - 100) - (Height - 150) / 2. For example, a man is 180 cm: (180 - 100) - (180 - 150) / 4 = 80 - 7.5 = 72.5 kg.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to use the calculator for children?
faqItems.a: Ideal weight formulas are intended for adults (18 years and older). For children and adolescents, other calculation methods are used that take into account age, gender and developmental stages. For children, consultation with a pediatrician is recommended.

faqItems.q: Does body type affect ideal weight?
faqItems.a: Yes, your body type (asthenic, normosthenic, hypersthenic) affects your ideal weight. People with wide bones (hypersthenics) can be overweight and still be healthy. Ideal weight formulas give average values.

faqItems.q: What is normal weight?
faqItems.a: Normal weight is the weight range at which a person has minimal health risks. Normal weight is usually within ±10% of ideal weight. For example, with an ideal weight of 70 kg, normal weight is 63-77 kg.

faqItems.q: How to calculate normal weight range?
faqItems.a: Normal Weight Range = Ideal Weight ± 10%. For example, with an ideal weight of 70 kg: Minimum = 70 × 0.9 = 63 kg, Maximum = 70 × 1.1 = 77 kg. Normal weight is 63-77 kg.

faqItems.q: What is the difference between ideal and normal weight?
faqItems.a: Ideal weight is the optimal weight for a particular person. Normal weight is the weight range (±10% of ideal) in which a person is considered healthy. Normal weight has a wider range than ideal weight.

faqItems.q: How to calculate the ideal weight for athletes?
faqItems.a: For athletes, ideal weight formulas may be inaccurate because they have a higher percentage of muscle mass. Athletes can weigh above their ideal weight but still have a low body fat percentage. For athletes, consultation with a coach or sports physician is recommended.

faqItems.q: Does the calculator take muscle mass into account?
faqItems.a: No, ideal weight formulas do not take muscle mass into account. They are based on height, gender and sometimes age. For people with developed muscles (athletes, bodybuilders), the ideal weight according to formulas may be underestimated.

faqItems.q: How often should you check your ideal weight?
faqItems.a: Ideal weight remains relatively constant after adulthood and the end of growth (usually after 18-20 years). You can check every few months or if there are significant changes in weight.

faqItems.q: What should I do if my weight is very different from my ideal weight?
faqItems.a: If your weight differs significantly from your ideal weight (more than 20%), consultation with a doctor or nutritionist is recommended. They will help you create a plan for normalizing your weight, taking into account your individual health characteristics.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to achieve your ideal weight quickly?
faqItems.a: Rapid weight loss or gain can be harmful to your health. A gradual weight change is recommended: 0.5-1 kg per week. Rapid changes can lead to metabolic and health problems.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ideal weight during pregnancy?
faqItems.a: During pregnancy, weight increases due to the fetus, placenta, amniotic fluid and other factors. Ideal weight formulas are not intended for pregnant women. Consultation with a gynecologist is recommended for weight control during pregnancy.

faqItems.q: Does height affect ideal weight?
faqItems.a: Yes, height is the main factor in calculating your ideal weight. The higher your height, the higher your ideal weight. All formulas take growth into account as the main parameter.

faqItems.q: Which formula is best for tall people?
faqItems.a: For tall people (over 190 cm), the Lorenz, Devin and Humvee formulas usually give more accurate results than the simple Broca formula. Broca's formula may overestimate ideal weight for tall people.

faqItems.q: Which formula is best for short people?
faqItems.a: For short people (less than 160 cm), all formulas give relatively similar results. Lorentz's formula may be a little more accurate since it takes into account adjustments for different heights.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ideal weight for older people?
faqItems.a: For older people (65+), the ideal weight may be slightly higher, as muscle mass decreases with age. However, the ideal weight formulas remain the same. It is recommended to consult a doctor to take into account age-related features.

faqItems.q: What is body mass index (BMI) and how is it related to ideal weight?
faqItems.a: BMI = Weight / (Height in meters)². Ideal weight corresponds to a BMI in the range of 18.5-24.9 (normal weight). Ideal weight can be calculated from BMI: Weight = BMI × (Height in meters)². For example, with a height of 1.75 m and a BMI of 22: Weight = 22 × 3.0625 = 67.4 kg.

faqItems.q: How to take into account fat percentage when calculating ideal weight?
faqItems.a: Ideal weight formulas do not directly take into account body fat percentage. For a more accurate assessment, it is recommended to measure the percentage of fat (calipers, bioimpedance) and take into account muscle mass. Normal body fat percentage: men 10-20%, women 18-28%.

faqItems.q: Can I use a calculator to plan my diet?
faqItems.a: Yes, an ideal weight calculator can help you determine your diet goal. However, to create a nutrition and exercise plan, consultation with a nutritionist or fitness trainer is recommended.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ideal weight for people with amputations?
faqItems.a: For people with amputations, special formulas are used taking into account the amputated body parts. Ideal weight formulas do not take amputations into account. It is recommended to consult a doctor for an accurate calculation.

faqItems.q: Does heredity affect ideal weight?
faqItems.a: Yes, heredity affects body type, metabolism and tendency to gain weight. However, ideal weight formulas are based on averages and do not take into account heredity. To take into account hereditary factors, consultation with a doctor is recommended.

faqItems.q: How to calculate ideal weight for diabetes?
faqItems.a: For people with diabetes, weight control is especially important. Ideal weight formulas can be used, but individual characteristics of the disease must be taken into account. It is recommended to consult an endocrinologist to create a weight normalization plan.

faqItems.q: What is Robinson's formula?
faqItems.a: Robinson's formula is another formula for calculating ideal weight. For men: Ideal weight = 52 + 1.9 × (Height in inches - 60). For women: Ideal weight = 49 + 1.7 × (Height in inches - 60). The formula gives results close to Devin's formula.

faqItems.q: What is Miller's formula?
faqItems.a: Miller's formula is a formula for calculating ideal weight, developed in 1983. For men: Ideal weight = 56.2 + 1.41 × (Height in inches - 60). For women: Ideal weight = 53.1 + 1.36 × (Height in inches - 60). The formula is considered more accurate for modern people.

faqItems.q: How to compare the results of different formulas?
faqItems.a: It is recommended to calculate your ideal weight using several formulas and take the average value or range. If results vary greatly (more than 5 kg), it may be worth consulting with your doctor to determine the most appropriate formula.

faqItems.q: Is it possible to use ideal weight as the only criterion for health?
faqItems.a: No, ideal weight is only one of the indicators. Fat percentage, muscle mass, general well-being, physical activity, and nutrition are also important. To fully assess your health, a comprehensive examination is recommended.
